Sequence Information.Source: Litoria citropa (Australian blue mountains tree frog)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Leuconostoc lactis (MIC=3 µg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=100 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=12 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=25 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=25 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=12 µg/ml). (Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the dorsal and submental skin glands.

Literature.Title: Host defence peptides from the skin glands of the Australian blue mountains tree-frog Litoria citropa. Solution structure of the antibacterial peptide citropin 1.1.
Literature.Author: Wegener KL, Wabnitz PA, Carver JA, Bowie JH, Chia BC, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.

Literature.Title: Host-defence peptides of Australian anurans structure, mechanism of action and evolutionary significance.
Literature.Author: Apponyi MA, Pukala TL, Brinkworth CS, Maselli VM, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Booker GW, Wallace JC, Carver JA, Separovic F, Doyle J, Llewellyn LE.
